headline: CNN This Morning
subHeadline: Dems Panicking After Disappointing Black Voter Turnout in 2022; Harvard Names Claudine Gay as School's First Black President; Airlines Pulling Back On Perks As Travel Demand Surges; FIFA Rebuffs Zelensky's Request To Share Message Of Peace; Anderson Cooper & Andy Cohen Talk Datings Apps On Colbert. Aired 6:30-7a ET

utterances.speaker: DOVERE
utterances.sentences: It was stronger than in most other places around the country, and that's a really big part of this, and that's why you see a lot of people saying, let's look to Georgia, what Raphael Warnock did there, and specifically, it's Raphael Warnock in that Senate race that it mattered in. Stacey Abrams was doing well with black voters about par with where Warnock did. She did not have the support of independent and swing voters, suburban voters, in the same way that Warnock did that helped deliver the runoff to him and get him that seat, secured for the next six years.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes. It wasn't the Democratic Party that was getting black voter turnout. It was people, like black votes, black voters matter, and other--

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Fair Fight (ph).

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: --and Fair Fight. Those are the people that were getting the black - both voters to show up. So, the Democratic Party has got some work to do in working with--

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Sounds like it.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: --organizations.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Everyone should read your reporting, Isaac, on CNN.com. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: DOVERE
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: This morning, administrators at Winston-Salem State University in North Carolina trying to explain why police slapped handcuffs on this student over a dispute with one of her professors. Look.(VIDEO PLAYING)

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: So, the video went viral. It captures the arrest inside a classroom at the historically black university. Dianne Gallagher live for CNN this morning in Charlotte, North Carolina. Dianne, good morning to you. That shows the arrest. We don't know what happened before, but it's certainly very disturbing. What do we know about this altercation, and how did police get involved in this? DIANNE GALLAGHER, CNN NATIONAL CORRESPONDENTNow, look, according to both the school and a student who shot video there, they say that this all started over an assignment. This was the final exam day, according to that student. That same student tells us at no point where there physical threats, and their classmate and the professor were on different sides of the classroom. They weren't near each other. According to the school, it was actually a different faculty member who called the police. But, look, there is this additional layer here. This is in HBCU, and look, the chancellor issued a statement saying in part, "In accordance with law enforcement procedures, our officers' first priority is to assess the situation and provide every opportunity for a positive resolution. We understand that the weaponization of police is a prevalent problem in our community. However, that is not what happened in this incident." Again, we're not exactly sure what caused it to escalate to what we see in that video there. This was a real arrest, Don. That student is charged with disorderly conduct.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes. Let us know when you get more information, but definitely we should dig in to find out what happened. Thank you Dianne. Appreciate it.

utterances.speaker: GALLAGHER
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Also this morning, Harvard University making history by naming its first black president. Arts and Sciences Dean, Claudine Gay, has been tapped as the institution's 30th president. She is also only the second woman to hold that position. Gay's field of study is political behavior with a focus on race and politics in the United States.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: CLAUDINE GAY, INCOMING PRESIDENT, HARVARD UNIVERSITY
utterances.sentences: As a woman of color, as a daughter of immigrants, if my presence in this role affirms someone's sense of belonging at Harvard, that is a great honor.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Claudine Gay steps into her new role, her new job, in July.Also today, the travel demand is surging right around the holidays. That means less love from the airline sadly, and fewer perks for you. Plus,-- (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP) REP. ADAM KINZINGER (R-IL): Had I known that standing up for truth would cost me my job, friendships, and even my personal security, I would, without hesitation, do it all over again. (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Powerful words from a Republican--(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: KINZINGER
utterances.sentences: I can rest at night, knowing that I fulfilled my oath to the office.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: All right. New this morning. We are about to hit another major holiday travel rush. United Airlines CEO Scott Kirby told us on the show earlier this week that the airline is actually setting new records each month. But, consumer advocates warn that that means some airlines are going to be cutting back on courting consumers. CNN's Pete Muntean is live, where else, at Reagan National Airport. Pete, I'm just telling you that you're going to have to pry my diamond medallion status out of my cold dead hands, if they're trying to take this away.

utterances.speaker: PETE MUNTEAN, CNN AVIATION CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: The good news here, Kaitlan, is that some airlines are not doing this, but some airlines simply are not trying as hard to court passengers. The equation here is pretty simple. The numbers are up. We're seeing numbers airlines have not seen since before the pandemic, and that means the value of your loyalty is going down.Stephanie Obogu (ph) is a proud frequent flyer, now frequently frustrated by the airlines. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: STEPHANIE OBOGU
utterances.sentences: They wanted us to take advantage of travel, and then we finally do, and it's like, oh, wait, wait, wait. Now, it's too much.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: MUNTEAN
utterances.sentences: Scott Keyes of Scott's Cheap Flights says airlines are cutting back on perks now that travel numbers are back near pre- pandemic levels. United Airlines is anticipating end of year holiday travel even bigger than this past Thanksgiving. Next year, it will raise the bar on earning frequent flyer status, making it harder to get free upgrades and fees waived.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: KEYES
utterances.sentences: It's going to be much more difficult to get into lounges, much more difficult to renew elite status, and much more difficult to redeem their frequent flyer miles for a free trip.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: MUNTEAN
utterances.sentences: A Delta flight from LAX to JFK over spring break would typically cost you 25,000 frequent flyer miles for an economy seat. Now, Scott's Cheap Flights says it will cost more than twice that, 52,000 miles.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Well, I think we are at a tipping point.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: MUNTEAN
utterances.sentences: Consumer advocate say earning miles has never been easier, thanks to airline credit cards. But now, redeeming miles is getting tougher.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: You enter these programs in good faith and you invest in them for years and years, and you find that the goalposts are a lot further away than they were when you started.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Airlines there, they're missing the mark here. I hope that they listen to the consumer and they really think about some of the decisions that they're making at the top level.(END VIDEO CLIP) MUNTEAN: Consumer advocates point out that there are big winners and losers here. The winners are those with high status already, airline credit cards. The losers are those right on the cusp of earning status. One of the latest airlines to change its loyalty program, American Airlines, will make it harder to achieve "Gold Status" starting in March. It'll now be 40,000 points as the benchmark. It was 30,000 points that makes it harder, Kaitlan, to get things like free upgrades and free check bags.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Welcome back, everyone. Little sports news this morning, FIFA rebuffing a request from Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy to share a message of world peace at the World Cup final on Sunday. The source telling CNN, Zelenskyy's office is offering to appear in a video to fans in the stadium in Qatar ahead of the kickoff, and was surprised by the negative response. Talks between Ukraine and FIFA are still underway though, according to the source. This year's World Cup has been mired in controversy over alleged human rights abuses in Qatar, and the silencing of players and fans for voicing support for the LGBTQ community.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: OK, switching gears, CNN's Anderson Cooper and Andy Cohen are making the rounds ahead of this year as New Year's Eve bash. They stopped by "The Late Show with Stephen Colbert" and they talked dating apps.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP) STEPHEN COLBERT, HOST, "THE LATE SHOW WITH STEPHEN COLBERT": New Year is obviously is all about new starts, fresh starts. People take a new approach to love. Andy, are you ready to get back out there? ANDY COHEN, HOST, "WATCH WHAT HAPPENS LIVE!": I am. I'm back out there. I'm on the apps. I'm on Tinder. I'm on Raya. I am -

utterances.speaker: COLBERT
utterances.sentences: What's Raya?

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Raya is like a members only. It's for dating thing. It's a lot - it seems like a lot of Instagram influencers.

utterances.speaker: COLBERT
utterances.sentences: Is there an interview process to get on with that?

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: You have to be referred by someone to get on.

utterances.speaker: COLBERT
utterances.sentences: Are you on there? COHENANDERSON COOPER, HOST, "ANDERSON COOPER 360": No. I'm not on an app. I don't-- (CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: COLBERT
utterances.sentences: --Tinder and Anderson Cooper comes out.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: COLBERT
utterances.sentences: My favorite thing is to talk about the Battle of Rorke's Drift. Let's sell Andy to the people out there. Best thing about your friend here.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: I mean, he is the life of the party. He is loyal. He is funny. He is a genuinely good person.

utterances.speaker: COLBERT
utterances.sentences: OK, let's be honest. What's the downside?

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Downside?

utterances.speaker: COLBERT
utterances.sentences: Well, you got to be honest.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: He works constantly.

utterances.speaker: COLBERT
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: He produces content around the clock, and it's exhausting to be around.

utterances.speaker: COLBERT
utterances.sentences: All right. All right. Andy, let's get - let's get Anderson out there. Let's sell some tickets to Anderson Cooper. What's the best?

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Silver Fox, you get lost in his big blue eyes, super smart, comes from the Vanderbilt lineage, a lot of baggage there.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: COLBERT
utterances.sentences: But, on the plus, he is a quick drunk.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Quick drunk, sheep day, hey giggler.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: That is true. Anderson get a little giggly when he - just wanted two glasses of wine.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: It's all it takes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: All it takes. Have you ever been on a dating app? Have you been on a dating app?

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Of course, I am on a dating app. LEMON

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Listen, a lot of guys - I actually take that. Moving on,--(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: But, we are going to talk about you because you are--

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Maybe on a dating app. I am not on a dating app.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: No. Tim, he is not on a dating app. But, you are on, New Year's Eve.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: New Year's Eve. I am back. I am back.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: So exciting.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Same old spot, right after Anderson and Andy.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Is mom going to make an appearance?

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: They don't drink down there, I heard.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: You read your Bible and you go to bed, but--(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: It will Bible verses with mom. And then, we'll be - no, we're going to have some fun. We'll see coming out.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Can't wait. I'm going to put the kids to bed and try to stay awake.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Coming up. So, this major announcement from - is this - this is the craziest story ever, like, is it still five years ago, Kaitlan, or still two years ago, NFTs?

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: It might be a craziest for today.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes. OK. This announcement turns out - Donald Trump's announcement turns out to be a digital trading cards up himself, reaction for President Biden and Steve Bannon.(COMMERCIAL BREAK) (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: ELON MUSK, CEO, TWITTER
utterances.sentences: There is not going to be any distinction in the future between journalists, so-called journalists, and regular people. Everyone is going to be treated the same. You're not special because you're a journalist.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Well, I don't know about that. Good morning, everyone. Friday, it's Friday. It's December 16. And, of course, there is Twitter high jinks (ph), Twitter banning the accounts of high profile journalists, is it a free speech issue or is Elon Musk just on a power trip right now?
